p: The leaf essential oil of N. ellipsoidea was dominated by ( E)-β-ocimene (87.6%). ( E)-β-Ocimene was also found to be the dominant compound (85.6%) in the leaf essential oil of N. polycarpa from Vietnam [ 32], and one of the major components in the leaf essential oils of N. sericea from Korea (13.3%) [ 38], N. variabillima from Taiwan (13.4%) [ 39], and N. aciculata from Korea (9.7%) [ 40]. In contrast, ( E)-β-ocimene was only a minor component in the leaf oils of N. australiensis, N. brassii, or N. dealbata from Australia [ 41], and N. pallens from India [ 42], and was not observed in N. foliosa leaf essential oil from India [ 43].
